question: Which of the following is a major shift in the 8th Five-Year Plan from its preceding ones?
option1: the significant reduction in public sector outlays
option2: the concentration of pubic investment in infra-structural sectors
option3: major investment in agriculture with a view to promote exports
option4: major investment in sectors in which industrial sickness has been a chronic problem
answer: the significant reduction in public sector outlays
explanation: One of the major highlight was modernization of the industries. The plan was launched with twin objectives of alleviation of poverty and unemployment. This plan period saw launching of many flagship programmes and reduction of public sector outlays. In the 8<sup>th</sup> five year plan, growth rate achieved was 6.8% against the target of 5.6%.
